main_point: The professor explains Wildfire ecology and fuel moisture and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes bioaccumulation (a process) from intermittency (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving hypoxia and salinity.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a lab mishap to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for runoff shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
